subject: Re: Problem with JUnit 3.7 and Ant 1.4
msgSnippet: ... for ... file to ... false, ... Thanks for the response - if I remember correctly, I didn t have the optional.jar on my machine so I did what you mentioned
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Chappell, Simon P" <simon.chappell@l...> wrote:
> As wild as it may sound, I find that the optional.jar doesn't work
for
> me and I had to go and download the jakarta-ant-1.4-optional.jar
file to
> get it working. I'll also assume that your junit.jar is in your
> classpath and that your test target works. If either of these are
false,
> let us know and we'll deliver up fresh advice! :-)
>
> Simon
>

Thanks for the response - if I remember correctly, I didn't have the
optional.jar on my machine so I did what you mentioned - downloaded
it and followed the directions from the website. I tried both
classpath references (junitpath and classpath) in the junit task
within build.xml. As you can see in build.xml, junit.jar is included
in the path.

Someone else made another recommendation, unfortunately I can't try
that yet since the code is only on my desktop at work!

> -----------------------------------------------------------------
> Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@l...
> Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
> Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526
>
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Mike Miller [mailto:Mike_Miller@t...]
> >Sent: Friday, January 04, 2002 5:20 PM
> >To: 'junit@y...'
> >Subject: [junit] Problem with JUnit 3.7 and Ant 1.4
> >
> >
> >I am attempting to run JUnit 3.7 from within Ant 1.4. I get an
> >NullPointerException when executing code like
> >"this.getClass().getPackage()". The getClass() method works but
the
> >getPackage() returns a null.
> >I added some debugging lines and found out that
> >this.getClass().getClassLoader() returns
> >org.apache.tools.ant.AntClassLoader@388993, and
> ><myclassname>.class.getClassLoader() returns a null.
> >This all works okay if I run JUnit from a cmd line using the
> >textui.TestRunner.
> >
> >Seems like I've got some setup problems. I do have the
optional.jar in
> >c:\ant\lib.
> >
> >Any suggestions on where else to look?
> >
> >build.xml below
> >---------------------------------------------------------------
> >----------
> ><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
> ><project basedir="." default="all" name="ewm">
> > <!-- change these if necessary -->
> > <property name="servlet.jar"
> >value="/opt/jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3/lib/servlet.jar"/>
> > <property name="j2ee.jar"
value="/j2sdkee1.2.1/lib/j2ee.jar"/>
> > <property name="junit.jar" value="/junit3.7/junit.jar"/>
> > <property name="junit.jar" value="/junit3.7/optional.jar"/>
> > <property name="web-inf" value="../WEB-INF/"/>
> > <property name="src-dir" value="."/>
> > <property name="dest-dir" value="${web-inf}/classes"/>
> >
> > <path id="classpath">
> > <fileset dir="${web-inf}/lib">
> > <include name="*"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <pathelement location="${servlet.jar}"/>
> > <pathelement location="${j2ee.jar}"/>
> > <pathelement location="${junit.jar}"/>
> > <pathelement location="${dest-dir}"/>
> > </path>
> >
> > <path id="junitpath">
> > <pathelement location="${dest-dir}"/>
> > </path>
> >
> > <!-- Set the properties related to the Source tree -->
> > <target name="init">
> > </target>
> >
> > <!-- Cleans all the existing classes in the destination
> >directory.
> >All the subdirectories are deleted-->
> > <target depends="init" name="clean">
> > <delete includeEmptyDirs="true">
> > <fileset dir="${dest-dir}"/>
> > </delete>
> > </target>
> >
> > <target depends="init,clean,compile" name="all">
> > </target>
> >
> > <target depends="init" name="compile">
> > <javac debug="true" deprecation="true"
> >destdir="${dest-dir}"
> >srcdir="${src-dir}">
> > <classpath refid="classpath"/>
> > </javac>
> > </target>
> >
> > <target depends="init" name="unittest">
> > <junit printsummary="on">
> > <formatter type="plain"/>
> > <classpath refid="junitpath"/>
> > <!-- <classpaty refid="classpath"/>-->
> > <test
> >name="ewm.timepay.empassign.model.EmpAssignModelTest"/>
> > </junit>
> > </target>
> ></project>
> >
> >
> >
> >
